alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Watch issued November 30 at 4:03AM AKST until December 01 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Northeast winds 35 to 55 mph with gusts up to 75 mph possible. * WHERE...Valdez and Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...High winds could move loose debris, damage property, and cause power outages. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of blowing snow are also possible from Thompson Pass to Valdez Thursday morning due to the combination of strong winds and fresh snow on the ground in the wake of the expected light snow event Wednesday evening. Expect reduced visibilities in areas of blowing snow. Use caution when traveling.
info.instruction: A high wind watch means there is potential for a hazardous high wind event. Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe location prior to the onset of winds.
